oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CIMMYT's maize germplasm management, improvement, and utilization program
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vasal, S.K.
Ortega Corona, A.
Pandey, S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Germplasm
Zea mays

Disease resistance

Developing Countries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Improving the maize plant is the subject of this publication. It first outlines several population improvement schemes and then focuses on the approach that CIMMYT has adopted in its own maize program. The structure and activities of the various units comprised by this program are discussed--such as the "back-up" unit, which handles the Center's maize germplasm bank and 29 gene pools and the "advanced" unit, which works with its populations. The publication also describes the program's efforts to improve maize for special attributes, including earliness and resistance to various diseases, and describes problems and strategies in the development of quality
